data.title: A royal baby is on the way! Crown Prince Hussein and Princess Rajwa of Jordan announce they are expecting their first child
data.meta_description: Crown Prince Hussein, son of King Abdullah II and Queen Rania, and Rajwa Al Saif were married in a stunning ceremony last summer
data.text:
Congratulations are in order for the Jordanian Crown Prince and Princess, for the couple have announced they are expecting their first baby.

Crown Prince Hussein of Jordan, son of King Abdullah II and Queen Rania, and Rajwa Al Saif were married in a stunning ceremony last summer which was the biggest wedding of 2023. Big names from around the world travelled to Jordan for the royal spectacular, including the Prince and Princess of Wales, Princess Beatrice and her husband Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi, the First Lady of the USA, Queen Sofia of Spain and the Sultan and Prince of Brunei.

Read More

Heartache for Peter Phillips: Late Queen’s ‘favourite grandson’ splits from his ‘rock solid’ girlfriend Lindsay Wallace

Princess Anne’s son had been dating Lindsay for three years, with the stay-at-home mother joining the royal family at a number of high-profile events

Indeed the Prince of Brunei, Abdul Mateen, was perhaps getting inspiration for his own wedding, which was marked with a 10 day celebration. Crown Prince Frederik and Crown Princess Mary were also in attendance, a pair who have been at the forefront of royal discussions this year, since Frederik’s mother Queen Margrethe’s shock abdication on New Year’s Eve. So, all the major players were out for the celebration in Jordan.

And now, it has been announced the couple are going to have a baby. The news was revealed today by the Jordanian Royal Family in a statement, which said: ‘The Royal Hashemite Court is pleased to announce that Their Royal Highnesses Prince Hussein bin Abdullah II, Crown Prince, and Princess Rajwa Al Hussein, are expecting, with God’s help and grace, their first child, in the summer of this year.

Read More

As Nicola Peltz Beckham celebrates her wedding anniversary, Tatler revisits her August 2022 cover where she opened up about marriage to Brooklyn

Big-screen success, A-list connections and a glamorous surname. Nicola Peltz Beckham talked high life and home life with Ellie Austin, and posed for Ellen von Unwerth

‘The Royal Hashemite Court extends its sincere congratulations to Their Majesties King Abdullah II and Queen Rania Al Abdullah on this occasion, and wishes Their Royal Highnesses Crown Prince Al Hussein and Princess Rajwa good health and joy as they welcome their baby.’

Read More

How Princess Haya of Jordan’s royal marriage went from intimate wedding to record-breaking divorce

Princess Haya of Jordan and Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, who married this week in 2004, saw their divorce play out in the British courts

Since their wedding the pair have remained very under-the-radar. In January, Crown Prince Hussein of Jordan and Princess Rajwa made a rare public appearance as they set off on an official visit to Singapore. The pair attended the launch of the Jordan-Singapore Tech Alliance Forum, an event organised by the Ministry of Digital Economy and Entrepreneurship, Jordan’s embassy in Singapore, the Singapore Business Federation, and SH Tech. Prince Hussein was a major feature at the event, making a speech to outline how Jordan ‘aspires to be a rising force on the global tech scene.’
